trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Facebook at Work | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Facebook at Work | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Facebook at Work.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Facebook at Work.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Facebook at Work
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Facebook at Work

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Facebook at Work with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate Facebook at Work with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: Integrating Facebook at Work with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: Integrating Facebook at Work with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Facebook at Work
trans-unit.target: You can control in Azure AD who has access to Facebook at Work

trans-unit.source: You can automatically provision account for users who have been granted access to Facebook at Work
trans-unit.target: You can automatically provision account for users who have been granted access to Facebook at Work

trans-unit.source: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Facebook at Work (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts
trans-unit.target: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to Facebook at Work (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts

trans-unit.source: You can manage your accounts in one central location
trans-unit.target: You can manage your accounts in one central location

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see [What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-appssoaccess-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD integration with CS Stars, you need the following items:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD integration with CS Stars, you need the following items:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD subscription

trans-unit.source: Facebook at Work with single sign on enabled
trans-unit.target: Facebook at Work with single sign on enabled

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:

trans-unit.source: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure AD trial environment, you can get a one-month trial [here](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Adding Facebook at Work from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding Facebook at Work from the gallery

trans-unit.source: To configure the integration of Facebook at Work into Azure AD, you need to add Facebook at Work from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To configure the integration of Facebook at Work into Azure AD, you need to add Facebook at Work from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: To add Facebook at Work from the gallery, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add Facebook at Work from the gallery, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Azure Management Portal**, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: ![Active Directory][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Active Directory][1]

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][2]

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][3]

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: ![Applications][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Applications][4]

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type **Facebook at Work**.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type **Facebook at Work**.

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Facebook at Work**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Facebook at Work**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Facebook at Work with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Facebook at Work with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Facebook at Work, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with Facebook at Work, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: After adding Facebook at Work in the Azure management portal, click **Configure Single Sign-On**.
trans-unit.target: After adding Facebook at Work in the Azure management portal, click **Configure Single Sign-On**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configure App URL** screen, enter the URL where users will sign into your Facebook at Work application.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configure App URL** screen, enter the URL where users will sign into your Facebook at Work application.

trans-unit.source: This is your Facebook at Work tenant URL
trans-unit.target: This is your Facebook at Work tenant URL

trans-unit.source: (Example: https://example.facebook.com/).
trans-unit.target: (Example: https://example.facebook.com/).

trans-unit.source: Once finished, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Once finished, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Facebook at Work company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Facebook at Work company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions at the following URL to configure Facebook at Work to use Azure AD as an identity provider: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/authentication/cloud-providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/authentication/cloud-providers)
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions at the following URL to configure Facebook at Work to use Azure AD as an identity provider: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/authentication/cloud-providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/authentication/cloud-providers)

trans-unit.source: Once completed, return to the browser windows showing the Azure management portal, click the checkbox to confirm you have completed the procedure, then click **Next** and **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: Once completed, return to the browser windows showing the Azure management portal, click the checkbox to confirm you have completed the procedure, then click **Next** and **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: Automatically provisioning users to Facebook at Work
trans-unit.target: Automatically provisioning users to Facebook at Work

trans-unit.source: Azure AD supports the ability to automatically synchonize the account details of assigned users to Facebook at Work.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD supports the ability to automatically synchonize the account details of assigned users to Facebook at Work.

trans-unit.source: This automatic sychronization enables Facebook at Work to get the data it needs to authorize users for access, in advance of them attempting to sign-in for the first time.
trans-unit.target: This automatic sychronization enables Facebook at Work to get the data it needs to authorize users for access, in advance of them attempting to sign-in for the first time.

trans-unit.source: It also de-provisions users from Facebook at Work when access has been revoked in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: It also de-provisions users from Facebook at Work when access has been revoked in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Automatic provisioning can be set up by clicking **Configure account provisioning** in the Azure management portal window.
trans-unit.target: Automatic provisioning can be set up by clicking **Configure account provisioning** in the Azure management portal window.

trans-unit.source: For additional details on how to configure automatic provisioning, see [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/provisioning/cloud-providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/provisioning/cloud-providers)
trans-unit.target: For additional details on how to configure automatic provisioning, see [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/provisioning/cloud-providers](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-at-work/provisioning/cloud-providers)

trans-unit.source: Assigning users to Facebook at Work
trans-unit.target: Assigning users to Facebook at Work

trans-unit.source: For provisioned AAD users to be able to see Facebook at Work on their Access Panel, they must be assigned access inside the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: For provisioned AAD users to be able to see Facebook at Work on their Access Panel, they must be assigned access inside the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Facebook at Work:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Facebook at Work:

trans-unit.source: On the start page for Facebook at Work in the Azure management portal, click **Assign accounts**.
trans-unit.target: On the start page for Facebook at Work in the Azure management portal, click **Assign accounts**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Show** menu, select whether you want to assign a user or a group to Facebook at Work and click the Checkmark button.
trans-unit.target: In the **Show** menu, select whether you want to assign a user or a group to Facebook at Work and click the Checkmark button.

trans-unit.source: In the resulting list, select the users or group to whom you want to assign Facebook at Work.
trans-unit.target: In the resulting list, select the users or group to whom you want to assign Facebook at Work.

trans-unit.source: In the page footer, click the **Assign** button.
trans-unit.target: In the page footer, click the **Assign** button.
